}} Sir 'Ghillean Tolmie Prance' MA DPhil DSc FLS FIBiol FRGS FRS VMH (born 13
July 1937) is a prominent British botanist and ecologist.

He has published extensively on the taxonomy of families such as Chrysobalanaceae and Lecythidaceae, but
he perhaps drew more attention in documenting the pollination ecology of
[[Victoria amazonica]]. The foremost public office he held
was as director of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew (1988â1999). He was knighted
in 1995. Since his retirement he has remained very active, notably involving
himself with the Eden Project. Prance, a devout Christian, is currently the
chair of A Rocha and president of Christians in Science.

He is actively involved on environmental issues, a trustee of the Amazon
Charitable Trust, and a Vice-President of the Nature in Art Trust. A biography of Prance was written by Clive
Langmead.
